intro: Siphocampylus phyllobotrys, commonly known as the leafy bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along its stem, and it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It is a perennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
